intro: Monadenium ellenbeckii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact, succulent growth form. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in dense clusters. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its thick leaves and deep root system. Monadenium ellenbeckii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
